alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 6:46PM MST until August 14 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Eastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 1015 PM MST. * At 646 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paloma and Sentinel. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
